trans-unit.source: What are App Passwords in Azure MFA?
trans-unit.target: What are App Passwords in Azure MFA?

trans-unit.source: This page will help users understand what app passwords are and what they are used for with regard to Azure MFA.
trans-unit.target: This page will help users understand what app passwords are and what they are used for with regard to Azure MFA.

trans-unit.source: Certain non-browser apps, such as the Apple native email client that uses Exchange Active Sync, currently do not support multi-factor authentication.
trans-unit.target: Certain non-browser apps, such as the Apple native email client that uses Exchange Active Sync, currently do not support multi-factor authentication.

trans-unit.source: Multi-factor authentication is enabled per user.
trans-unit.target: Multi-factor authentication is enabled per user.

trans-unit.source: This means that if a user has been enabled for multi-factor authentication and they are attempting to use non-browser apps, they will be unable to do so.
trans-unit.target: This means that if a user has been enabled for multi-factor authentication and they are attempting to use non-browser apps, they will be unable to do so.

trans-unit.source: An app password allows this to occur.
trans-unit.target: An app password allows this to occur.

trans-unit.source: Modern Authentication for the Office 2013 Clients
trans-unit.target: Modern Authentication for the Office 2013 Clients

trans-unit.source: Office 2013 clients (including Outlook) now support new Authentication Protocols and can be enabled to support Multi-Factor Authentication.
trans-unit.target: Office 2013 clients (including Outlook) now support new Authentication Protocols and can be enabled to support Multi-Factor Authentication.

trans-unit.source: This means that once enabled, app passwords are not required for use with Office 2013 clients.
trans-unit.target: This means that once enabled, app passwords are not required for use with Office 2013 clients.

trans-unit.source: For more information see <linkText>Office 2013 modern authentication public preview announced</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information see <linkText>Office 2013 modern authentication public preview announced</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The following are some things to remember on how to use app passwords.
trans-unit.target: The following are some things to remember on how to use app passwords.

trans-unit.source: The actual password is automatically generated and is not supplied by the user.
trans-unit.target: The actual password is automatically generated and is not supplied by the user.

trans-unit.source: This is because the automatically generated password, is harder for an attacker to guess and is more secure.
trans-unit.target: This is because the automatically generated password, is harder for an attacker to guess and is more secure.

trans-unit.source: Currently there is a limit of 40 passwords per user.
trans-unit.target: Currently there is a limit of 40 passwords per user.

trans-unit.source: If you attempt to create one after you have reached the limit, you will be prompted to delete one of your existing app passwords in order to create a new one.
trans-unit.target: If you attempt to create one after you have reached the limit, you will be prompted to delete one of your existing app passwords in order to create a new one.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that app passwords be created per device and not per application.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended that app passwords be created per device and not per application.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can create one app password for your laptop and use that app password for all of your applications on that laptop.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can create one app password for your laptop and use that app password for all of your applications on that laptop.

trans-unit.source: You are given an app password the first time you sign-in.
trans-unit.target: You are given an app password the first time you sign-in.

trans-unit.source: If you need additional ones, you can create them.
trans-unit.target: If you need additional ones, you can create them.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Setup</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Setup</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Once you have an app password, you use this in place of your original password with these non-browser apps.
trans-unit.target: Once you have an app password, you use this in place of your original password with these non-browser apps.

trans-unit.source: So for instance, if you are using multi-factor authentication and the Apple native email client on your phone.
trans-unit.target: So for instance, if you are using multi-factor authentication and the Apple native email client on your phone.

trans-unit.source: Use the app password so that it can bypass multi-factor authentication and continue to work.
trans-unit.target: Use the app password so that it can bypass multi-factor authentication and continue to work.

trans-unit.source: During your initial sign-in you are given an app password that you can use.
trans-unit.target: During your initial sign-in you are given an app password that you can use.

trans-unit.source: Additionally you can also create and delete app passwords later on.
trans-unit.target: Additionally you can also create and delete app passwords later on.

trans-unit.source: How you do this depends on how you use multi-factor authentication.
trans-unit.target: How you do this depends on how you use multi-factor authentication.

trans-unit.source: Choose the one that most applies to you.
trans-unit.target: Choose the one that most applies to you.

trans-unit.source: How you use multi-factor authentiation
trans-unit.target: How you use multi-factor authentiation

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: <linkText>I use it with Office 365</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>I use it with Office 365</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: This means that you will want to create app passwords through the Office 365 portal.
trans-unit.target: This means that you will want to create app passwords through the Office 365 portal.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>I don't know</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>I don't know</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: This means you will want create app passwords through <linkText>https://myapps.microsoft.com</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: This means you will want create app passwords through <linkText>https://myapps.microsoft.com</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>I use it with Microsoft Azure</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>I use it with Microsoft Azure</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: This means that you will want create app passwords through the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: This means that you will want create app passwords through the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: If you use multi-factor authentication with Office 365 you will want to create and delete app passwords through the Office 365 portal.
trans-unit.target: If you use multi-factor authentication with Office 365 you will want to create and delete app passwords through the Office 365 portal.

trans-unit.source: Log on to the <linkText>Office 365 portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the <linkText>Office 365 portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the top right corner select the widget and choose Office 365 Settings.
trans-unit.target: In the top right corner select the widget and choose Office 365 Settings.

trans-unit.source: Click on Additional security verification.
trans-unit.target: Click on Additional security verification.

trans-unit.source: On the right, click the link that says Update my phone numbers used for account security. Setup
trans-unit.target: On the right, click the link that says Update my phone numbers used for account security. Setup

trans-unit.source: This will take you to the page that will allow you to change your settings.
trans-unit.target: This will take you to the page that will allow you to change your settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Cloud</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Cloud</linkText>

trans-unit.source: At the top, next to additional security verification, click on app passwords.
trans-unit.target: At the top, next to additional security verification, click on app passwords.

trans-unit.source: Click Create.
trans-unit.target: Click Create.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Cloud</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Cloud</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter a name for the app password and click Next.
trans-unit.target: Enter a name for the app password and click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create an app password</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create an app password</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Copy the app password to the clipboard and paste it into your app.
trans-unit.target: Copy the app password to the clipboard and paste it into your app.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create an app password</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create an app password</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Log on to the <linkText>Office 365 portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the <linkText>Office 365 portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the top right corner select the widget and choose Office 365 Settings.
trans-unit.target: In the top right corner select the widget and choose Office 365 Settings.

trans-unit.source: Click on Additional security verification.
trans-unit.target: Click on Additional security verification.

trans-unit.source: On the right, click the link that says Update my phone numbers used for account security. Setup
trans-unit.target: On the right, click the link that says Update my phone numbers used for account security. Setup

trans-unit.source: This will take you to the page that will allow you to change your settings.
trans-unit.target: This will take you to the page that will allow you to change your settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Cloud</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Cloud</linkText>

trans-unit.source: At the top, next to additional security verification, click on app passwords.
trans-unit.target: At the top, next to additional security verification, click on app passwords.

trans-unit.source: Next to the app password you want to delete, click Delete.
trans-unit.target: Next to the app password you want to delete, click Delete.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Delete an app password</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Delete an app password</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Confirm the deletion by clicking yes.
trans-unit.target: Confirm the deletion by clicking yes.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Confirm the delete</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Confirm the delete</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Once the app password is deleted you can click close.
trans-unit.target: Once the app password is deleted you can click close.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Close</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Close</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you are not sure how you use multi-factor authentication, then you can always create adn delete app passwords through the myapps portal.
trans-unit.target: If you are not sure how you use multi-factor authentication, then you can always create adn delete app passwords through the myapps portal.

trans-unit.source: Sign-in to <linkText>https://myapps.microsoft.com</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: Sign-in to <linkText>https://myapps.microsoft.com</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: At the top, select profile.
trans-unit.target: At the top, select profile.

trans-unit.source: Select Additional Security Verification.
trans-unit.target: Select Additional Security Verification.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Cloud</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Cloud</linkText>

trans-unit.source: This will take you to the page that will allow you to change your settings.
trans-unit.target: This will take you to the page that will allow you to change your settings.

trans-unit.source: At the top, next to additional security verification, click on app passwords.
trans-unit.target: At the top, next to additional security verification, click on app passwords.

trans-unit.source: Click Create.
trans-unit.target: Click Create.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create an app password</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create an app password</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter a name for the app password and click Next.

trans-unit.source: If you use multi-factor authentication with Azure you will want to create app passwords through the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: If you use multi-factor authentication with Azure you will want to create app passwords through the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Sign-in to the Azure Management portal.
trans-unit.target: Sign-in to the Azure Management portal.

trans-unit.source: At the top, right-click on your user name and select Additional Security Verification.
trans-unit.target: At the top, right-click on your user name and select Additional Security Verification.

trans-unit.source: On the proofup page, at the top, select app passwords
trans-unit.target: On the proofup page, at the top, select app passwords

trans-unit.source: Click Create.
trans-unit.target: Click Create.

trans-unit.source: Enter a name for the app password and click Next
trans-unit.target: Enter a name for the app password and click Next

trans-unit.source: Copy the app password to the clipboard and paste it into your app.
trans-unit.target: Copy the app password to the clipboard and paste it into your app.
